sleepMode.description: Sleep mode which is supported by a device

oneOf.description: Cyclic sleeping devices sleep for a period of time, then wake up, send a reading and go back to sleep, starting the cycle over again. The length of the sleep period is set via the INTVL command. After a number of wakes (as set by WAKEC) it will also send an AWAKE message and a BATT reading and then listen for 100 milliseconds, if no message is received the device sends a SLEEPING message and returns to sleep.
Interrupt sleeping device will sleep until an external interrupt is received. e.g. A button press
Polled sleeping device can be told to sleep for a period of time (SlEEP command), after which they will return to an awake state.

String of any valid Language of Things data characters
Floating point number
Whole number (integer)

Hexadecimal value that can only be read
Period of time represented as 3 digit value and period multiplier of T(milli seconds), S(seconds), M(minutes), H(hours), D(days)

Sleep mode represented as one of the follow. Sleep Off = 0 
 Interrupt = 8 
 Cyclic = 16 
 Polled = 32
Hexadecimal string when sent to a radio, ACK in response
Heating set point in formate of DSHHMMTT, where D Day of the week (1=Monday, 8=Holiday), S Set point (1-6), HH Hours (24H), MM Minutes, TT Temperature
Water set point in formate of DSHHMMOO, where D Day of the week (1=Monday, 8=Holiday), S Set point (1-6), HH Hours (24H), MM Minutes, OO ON OF
